intro: Lesquerella auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Lesquerella auriculata is notable for its ability to produce a unique seed oil that has industrial applications. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological and agricultural study.
